content.rendered:
Multilingualism is a SUPERPOWER! Don’t be discouraged from teaching your child a second or third language just because they are deaf or hard of hearing.

There are strategies families can use to help their children with hearing loss to be successful multilingual learners. These include planning and goal setting, developing family language strategies and keeping your child motivated by making it FUN!

Check out the links to our webinar and other great resources.

Download the Real Life Tip infographic.

More information:

  • Setting up children who are dhh to be successful multilingual learners – webinar
  • Resources for parents | Bilingual Family
  • Planting Languages
